first-steps.title: Welcome to {appName}
first-steps.preamble:
Just add a new note by clicking on the **plus icon** in the **lower right corner**.

There are different types of notes.

text.title: Text
text.help: This is a simple text note. When you copying this note, you copy the text which are you see. It is also possible to write the content in **Markdown**.

template.title: Template
template.help: This is a note where you can define a template (text) and placeholders. When you copy the contents of this note, you are prompted to fill in these placeholders. Then the template is copied with the **replaced** placeholders. This type is ideal for command line commands.

validation.invalid-character: It must start with a letter and must only contains numbers and letters!

picture.title: Picture
picture.help: This is a note in which you can deposit a **Image URL**. The image will be displayed and when you copy the content, you copy the URL of that image. This type is ideal for storing **[reaction GIFs](https://giphy.com/search/developer)** :)

delete.confirmation: Are you sure to delete this note?

help.title: Dashboard help
help.content:
Notes may contain **tags**. These tags can be used to **filter** notes .So that you do not always set this filter again, dashboards can be created.

Dashboards are a collection of filters. They have a **name**, an **icon** and are displayed in the **menu bar**. Thus, **categories** or frequently used filters can be realized.

delete.confirmation: Are you sure to delete this dashboard?

help.title: Encryption help
help.content:
The data is located locally on your device! They are explicitly **not** stored on a server. Nevertheless, they are stored by default **unencrypted** - and thus in readable form. If you do not want this, you can have the data encrypted. As a result, the notes are safe even if they lose the device!

To encrypt the data, you need a (good) **password**. From now on, you must enter this when starting the application.

**ATTENTION:** If you lose the password, your data **can not** be recovered! Because the password **is not** saved!.

If you have already saved data unencrypted, this is no problem! These can also be encrypted later. The reverse is also true: you can have your data stored in decrypted form and you do not have to enter a password at the start!
